summary: Under the Medicare Advantage program, private insurance companies contract with the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) to offer health plans that cover all services required by Medicare. We found some contracts in which people in poor health were much more likely than others to voluntarily leave the contracts' health plans. These contracts generally had lower quality scores, and their enrollees often cited problems...
title: Medicare Advantage: CMS Should Use Data on Disenrollment and Beneficiary Health Status to Strengthen Oversight
